column3: when the last prince escaped to Lithuania. The town frequently fell prey to the hordes of Tokhtamysh

column2: Serpukhov has become a local industrial center with textile
column5: and paper-producing industries. The SeAZ factory produces the Lada Oka microcar since the 1980s. The Prioksko-Terrasny Nature Reserve sprawls within 12 kilometers (7.5 mi) from the city.

column1: The city is linked by trains to Moscow and Tula and is on the M2 highway between Moscow and the Crimea. There are also river boat services along the Oka River.

Serpukhov is home to the Serpukhov Historical and Art Museum and the Serpukhov Art Gallery. The city is home to the Serpukhov Military Academy of Missile troops and branches of several Moscow based universities.
The city association football team FC Zvezda Serpukhov plays in the Russian second division.
